work.name: Art Blocks
work.summary: Art Blocks is a digital platform where generative artists publish unique artworks using creative code.
highlights: Develop algorithmic art projects with infinitely unique deterministic outputs
Utilize JavaScript Canvas API, p5.js, GLSL, and SVG
Create interactive exhibits using web frameworks such as Next.js
Collaborate with print shops to send physical artwork to collectors

work.name: Kawasaki Motors
work.summary: KMM Maryville is the primary General Purpose Engine production facility for Kawasaki. Their premium quality engines can be found in lawn and garden equipment produced by manufacturers across the industry.
highlights: Developed web-based program to improve extra parts packaging production
Integrated program into existing ERP system while ensuring data traceability
Used Visual LANSA, JavaScript, CSS, and SQL
Learned how to apply existing knowledge to learn new coding languages
Improved database design and UX practices

work.name: Knacktive
work.summary: Knacktive is an interdisciplinary student-run, full-service agency with students from the School of Communication and Mass Media, the Melvin D. and Valorie G. Booth School of Business, the Department of Fine and Performing Arts, and the School of Computer Science and Information Systems.
highlights: Designed logo and brand identity for client using Adobe Illustrator, Photoshop, and Premiere
Drafted website mock-up using Adobe XD
Experienced competitive marketing process with seven other team members
Obtained ability to work as a team under deadlines

work.name: A & M Amusements
work.summary: A & M Amusements is an inflatable rental company for parties or events.
highlights: Assembled new web pages, coded new website functions using HTML, CSS, and JavaScript
Created initial site in WordPress
Maintained consistent site style, edited product images in Photoshop
Learned how to effectively communicate with a client

awards.title: Northwest CSIS T-Shirt Design Contest Winner
awards.awarder: School of Computer Science and Information Systems
awards.summary: Students were given twenty days to design a t-shirt that pertained to computer science. The winner would have their t-shirt printed and sold by the university.

projects.name: thispage
highlights: Full-stack web app for book clubs featuring reading goals with automatic increments, discussion posts with nested comments, book polls, and notification emails
Uses Next.js, Tailwind, Zod, Supabase (Auth, RLS, Edge Functions), Vercel (Hosting), Resend, and Gitflow
Adheres to Semantic Versioning

projects.name: Formatic Fobs
highlights: Real-time 3D printing of user-customized keychains through MIDI knobs
Used Next.js, THREE.js, Node.js, Node SerialPort, and Web MIDI API
Experienced by hundreds of visitors at Art Blocks' Open House 2024

projects.name: Arcadia
highlights: Composed unifying algorithm that generated 256 unique digital art pieces
Used JavaScript, p5.js and GLSL
Sold out in 30 minutes during a Dutch formatted auction
Generated $8,000 (at the time) in ETH to donate to the charity GiveDirectly
